metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10769 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A buffer over-read flaw was found in RH kernel versions before 5.0 in crypto_authenc_extractkeys in crypto/authenc.c in the IPsec Cryptographic algorithm's module, authenc. When a payload longer than 4 bytes, and is not following 4-byte alignment boundary guidelines, it causes a buffer over-read threat, leading to a system crash. This flaw allows a local attacker with user privileges to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10769` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-145-generic - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-lowlatency - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-4.4.0-145-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-145-generic - 4.4.0-145.171
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-145-lowlatency - 4.4.0-145.171

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-145.171').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1079.89').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1051.56').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1037.39~16.04.1').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-55.60~16.04.2').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1043.49').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1018.20~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1106.114').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-145.171').
